rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MIGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. This is not the treatment group number.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MISPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number from the MI Findings page.

datasetVariables.name: MISPID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C132263

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MITESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in MITEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MITESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MITESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "HER2", "BRCA1","TTF1".
datasetVariables.label: Microscopic Examination Short Name
datasetVariables.name: MITESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C132262

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MITEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in MITEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2", "Breast Cancer Susceptibility Gene 1", "Thyroid Transcription Factor 1".
datasetVariables.label: Microscopic Examination Name
datasetVariables.name: MITEST

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MITSTDTL

datasetVariables.name: MITSTDTL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MISTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MIORRES in a standard format or standard units. MISTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MISTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: MISTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MISTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MISTRESC. MISTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: MISTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MISTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for MISTRESC and MISTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: MISTRESU

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MIRESCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. Examples: "MALIGNANT" or "BENIGN" for tumor findings.
datasetVariables.label: Result Category
datasetVariables.name: MIRESCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MISTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate examination not done or result is missing. Should be null if a result exists in MIORRES or have a value of "NOT DONE" when MIORRES = "NULL".
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: MISTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MIREASND

datasetVariables.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MISTAT when value is NOT DONE. Examples: "SAMPLE AUTOLYZED", "SPECIMEN LOST".
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Done
datasetVariables.name: MIREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MINAM

datasetVariables.description: Subject of the observation. Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "TISSUE", "BLOOD", "BONE MARROW".

datasetVariables.name: MISPEC

datasetVariables.description: Location relevant to the collection of the specimen. Examples: "LUNG", "KNEE JOINT", "ARM", "THIGH".
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Collection Location
datasetVariables.name: MILOC

datasetVariables.label: Specimen Directionality within Subject
datasetVariables.name: MIDIR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MIMETHOD

datasetVariables.description: Method of the test or examination. This could include the technique or type of staining used for the slides. Examples: "IHC", "Crystal Violet", "Safranin", "Trypan Blue", or "Propidium Iodide".
datasetVariables.label: Method of Test or Examination
datasetVariables.name: MIMETHOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MILOBXFL

datasetVariables.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
datasetVariables.name: MILOBXFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MI.MIBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. Note that MIBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: MIBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Example: "PATHOLOGIST", "PEER REVIEW", "SPONSOR PATHOLOGIST".

datasetVariables.name: MIEVAL

description: A findings domain that contains histopathology findings and microscopic evaluations. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C95095, 2018-06-29)

name: MI
